text: Boss Lady is an American television sitcom that aired on NBC as a summer replacement for Fireside Theatre from July 1 to September 23, 1952.The Complete Directory to Prime Time Network and Cable TV Shows 1946-Present. Ballantine Books. 2003. pg. 144. ==Plot== Gwen F. Allen was the chief executive Hillandale Homes, a construction firm. Her father was the Chairman of the Board. ==Production== Boss Lady was a production of Wrather Television Productions, Inc. Jack Wrather and Bob Mann were co-producers. Mann also wrote the scripts, and Bill Russell directed. ==Cast== *Lynn Bari as Gwen F. Allen *Nicholas Joy as Gwen's father *Glenn Langan as Jeff Standish *Charlie Smith as Chester Allen *Lee Patrick as Aggie *Richard Gainer as Roger ==Sponsor and schedule== Procter & Gamble sponsored Boss Lady, which was broadcast 9-9:30 p.m. (Eastern Daylight Time) on Tuesdays. ==References== Category:1952 American television series debuts Category:1952 American television series endings Category:NBC original programming Category:1950s American sitcoms Category:American workplace comedy television series Category:Black-and-white American television shows Category:English-language television shows
title: Boss Lady
